sentences.sentence: Italian elections is well underway, leading the example against abstention, which is expected to be around 30 percent, with some of the main party leaders, as well as the Italian president, Sergio Mattarella, who cast his vote in the Sicilian city of Palermo.

sentences.sentence: In Rome, the leader of the Democratic Party, Enrico Letta, looked optimistic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He's the main opposition to the strong right-wing coalition, which is expected to win this election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But polls show his alliance with the Greens has a slim chance of gaining a majority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In Milan, Matteo Salvini, the leader of Italy's anti-immigration party Ligue, appeared calm and relaxed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Part of the three-party right-wing coalition, in the past he has joined forces with populists as well as Prime Minister Mario Draghi's National Unity Coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The leader of Italy's Five Star Movement and former Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte cast his vote in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Those against the right-wing coalition are hoping for a surge in votes for his party, but his group is not part of any formal coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Also voting in Rome was the often controversial figure Silvio Berlusconi.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Leader of Forza Italia, he too is part of the three-party right-wing coalition along with Giorgia Maloney, leader of the Brothers of Italy. She is pipped to become the next prime minister and will vote at 10pm on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Around 51 million Italians are entitled to vote in the parliamentary elections here in

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: the capital. Rome is the city with the highest number of eligible voters now if we look back at the 2018 elections while a couple of things have changed first off some 2.6 million Italians that will vote for the first time for the Senate and that's because the minimum voting age was reduced from 25 to 18 but also the size of Italy's Parliament will be reduced to 400 members in the lower house and 200 members in the Senate from 630 and 315 respectively something that somehow will complicate efforts to forecast the final result also voter turnout is something that has to be monitored closely. That's because experts said that around 35 percent of Italians are not willing, are reluctant to go back to the polls. And if the trend is confirmed, they predicted an all-time low voter turnout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Italian right has ended fascism over history for decades now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is Giorgia Meloni's response after the international press described her as a danger to Italian, European and international democracy and stability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meloni is trying to reassure the public and international community she's the right person to become Italy's prime minister ex-leader of the neo-fascist Italian social movement Gianfranco Fini also used the strategy in seeking to create a more moderate image of the post fascist right in Italy at 15 years old Maloney was active in the youth branch of the Italian social movement from 1998 to 2002 Maloney was a representative for the province of Rome with the party Allianza Nazionale, the more moderate successor of the Italian social movement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In 2008, she joined Berlusconi's People of Freedom Party, becoming the youngest minister in the history of modern Italy. Five years later, Meloni left Berlusconi's party to create Brothers of Italy with Gianfranco La Russo and Guido Corsetto. The new party defends conservative nationalism with a strong emphasis on sovereignty. Maloney started with only 3% of votes during the 2013 elections, but her growth has been consistent over the past nine years. The real catalyzer for her party came with Giuseppe Conte's second government in 2019, when Brothers of Italy was practically the only major Italian party which chose to remain in opposition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The 45-year-old has successfully rounded up support due to her views opposing globalism, however, never slipping into an anti-system discourse. Yes to the natural family, no to the LGBTQ lobby. In Europe, Maloney continues to rub shoulders with the far right and the Euro skeptic parties such as Vox in Spain, but whether it's in Italy or abroad, experts believe Georgia Maloney must show her more moderate and institutional face.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: If elected, she will become the first leader from a post-fascist party in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.sentence: On the front line, soldiers have also expressed their vote.

sentences.sentence: Russia says the so-called voting will take place until Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Pink Floyd's co-founder Roger Waters has canceled concerts in Poland next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It follows outrage in the country over comments he made about Russia's war in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The band was scheduled to perform at Krakow Arena in April, but a venue spokesperson said Waters had withdrawn.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Earlier this month, he wrote an open letter to Ukraine's First Lady, blaming extreme nationalists in the country for setting a path to the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people gathered outside a Madrid bull ring to protest against Spain's bullfighting tradition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The demonstration called on authorities to end bullfighting and other similar activities involving the animal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bulls and bullfighting are currently exempt from Spain's new law that includes harsher penalties for the mistreatment of animals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Double Olympic champion Eliud Kipchoge has broken his own men's marathon world record in Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Kenyan crossed the line in a time of two hours, one minute and nine seconds, beating his personal best set four years ago by 30 seconds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Kipchoge has won 15 of his 17 career endurance races.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Just days before this year's Berlin Marathon, he had played down his chances of setting a new world record.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But now he's celebrating.
